The Palmetto Cluster

What is the Palmetto Cluster?

The Palmetto Cluster is a group of computers on Clemson’s campus. These computers are much more powerful than your laptop or even desktops in the lab.

Running computational chemistry calculations requires the use of these powerful computers. For research, you will log into the Palmetto Cluster remotely.

Logging in

  1. Open your termial (Terminal on Macs, PowerShell on Windows)
  2. Type ssh [username]@slogin.palmetto.clemson.edu
  3. Enter your password

This logs you in to a computer called the “login node”. “Node” is a computing term for a single computational unit within a cluster of computers.

Directory Structure

Just as your laptop has folders and files, you can create folders and files on Palmetto. In computing, folders are called directories.

  1. Make a new directory to store your tutorials. mkdir tutorials
  2. To check your work, type ls to list all directories and files. You should see tutorials.
  3. Make a file in the tutorials directory. First, move into that directory. cd tutorials
  4. What would you see if you typed ls here? Try it to check your understanding.
  5. To open a new file called my_file, type vim my_file This opens a new file with an editor called vim.

Check your understanding
